column4: Stop before turning right
column6: 4-way stop ahead
column8: Lane closed for traffic
column10: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 2. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column8: Rounabout rules apply.
column10: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.

column2: 3. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when it is hard to see ahead.
column6: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.
column8: when following motorcycles.

column4: Slow down or stop
column6: Stop if necessary
column8: You must make a complete stop
column10: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles

column4: No parking
column6: Two way left turn
column8: No right turn

column4: No left turn
column6: Road curves ahead
column8: Detour ahead

column2: 7. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column6: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column8: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column10: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.

column2: 8. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car that is traveling faster.
column6: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.
column8: The car approaching from the right.
column10: The car approaching from the left.

column2: 9. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
column4: double
column6: maintain
column8: reduce

column4: Reversible lane ahead.
column6: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: Divided highway ahead.

column4: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column6: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column8: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column10: remain near the left edge of the road.

column4: No right turn
column6: No Turning
column8: Side road

column4: A left turn can be made only after stopping
column6: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection
column8: Right turn is not permitted

column2: 14. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column4: The driver who does not control the car.
column6: No one.
column8: The driver on the left.

column2: 15. To pass a bicyclist traveling in the same direction on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you should:
column4: continue driving straight, it is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.
column6: slow down and wait until there is no oncoming traffic, then pass the bicyclist leaving him or her  sufficient space.
column8: honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.
column10: not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.

column2: 16. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column4: Air bag only
column6: Lap and shoulder belt only
column8: Pumping brakes.
column10: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.

column2: 17. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column6: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.

column4: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column6: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 19. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.
column6: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.
column8: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.
column10: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.

column4: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.
column6: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column8: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.
column10: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.

column2: 21. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You may not turn right
column6: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear
column8: You must increase your speed
column10: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding

column4: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column8: traffic from all four directions must stop.

column4: get off the car to see if it is clear to proceed.
column6: rely on your mirrors to see if it is clear to proceed.
column8: turn your head and look through the rear window.

column2: 24. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column6: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column8: traffic in the right lane must go straight.

column4: Divided highway ends.
column6: Divided highway ahead.
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
